fumble.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to try to hold, move, or find something with your hands in an awkward way
fumble.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She reached round to fumble the light on.
She dressed, her cold fingers fumbling with the buttons.
I fumbled around in my bag for a cigarette.
fumble.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if you fumble with your words when you are speaking, you have difficulty saying something
fumble.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The second candidate fumbled her lines.
Asked for an explanation, Mike had fumbled for words.
fumble.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to drop a ball after catching it
fumble.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Quarterback Rattay was hit and fumbled the ball.
